crawledPages.title: Investors | Tata group
crawledPages.content: Investors Welcome to the Investors' Page Financial Information and live stock data of the Tata companies To my father the acquisition of wealth was only a secondary object in life; it was always subordinate to the constant desire in his heart to improve the industrial and intellectual condition of the people of this country and the various enterprises which he from time to time undertook in his lifetime had for their principal object the advancement of India in these important respects." - Sir Dorabji Tata, while laying the foundation stone of the Lonavala Dam, 8 February, 1911 Founded by Jamsetji Tata in 1868, the Tata Group is a global enterprise, headquartered in India, comprising 31 companies across multiple verticals. The group operates in more than 100 countries across six continents, with a mission 'To improve the quality of life of the communities we serve globally, through long-term stakeholder value creation based on Leadership with Trust’. Tata Sons is the principal investment holding company and promoter of Tata companies. Sixty-six percent of the equity share capital of Tata Sons is held by philanthropic trusts, which support education, health, livelihood generation and art and culture. In 2024-25, the aggregate revenue of Tata companies was more than $180 billion. These companies collectively employ over one million people. Each Tata company or enterprise operates independently under the guidance and supervision of its own board of directors. There are 26 publicly listed Tata companies with an aggregate market capitalisation of more than $328 billion as on March 31, 2025. Scroll below to explore more about the Tata group. Information Holding Company Tata Sons Tata Sons is the principal investment holding company and promoter of Tata companies. FEEDS Tata Companies Stock Data List of Tata entities listed in the NSE and BSE Business Business Verticals Explore the business verticals that make the Tata group. Related Community Tata and the Community For over 150 years, we have been serving the communities in which we operate. People Careers and People Learn more about people, culture, and jobs at the Tata group and companies Values Values and Purpose The values that continue to direct the growth and business of Tata companies. Brands Tata Brands Showcase The Tata companies offer a range of products and services under various brand names.

crawledPages.title: TATAMOTORS Investor Relations - Tata Motors Ltd - Alpha Spread
crawledPages.content: Alpha Spread Alpha Spread Tata Motors Ltd NSE:TATAMOTORS Tata Motors Ltd Business Overview In the bustling corridors of India's industrial tapestry, Tata Motors Ltd. stands as a significant cornerstone, tracing its legacy back to its inception in 1945. Emerging from the broader Tata Group, a behemoth that thrives across various sectors, Tata Motors initially ventured into the commercial vehicle market, etching its name as a pioneer in Indian automotive engineering. This journey is led by a strategic vision that combines innovation with adaptability—a vision that saw the company launch its first commercial truck in collaboration with Daimler-Benz in 1954. Over the years, the company expanded its portfolio, scaling the ranks to offer passenger vehicles, utility vehicles, and even defense vehicles, each crafted to cater to the dynamically evolving demands of both domestic and international markets. Today, Tata Motors generates revenue through the manufacturing and sale of a diverse range of vehicles, from compact cars to heavy trucks. Its business model is anchored in comprehensive operations that span design and engineering, backed by robust manufacturing capabilities. A key catalyst in its financial engine is the success of its subsidiary, Jaguar Land Rover, acquired in 2008, which added a premium sheen to its global footprint. By focusing on innovation, quality, and sustainability, Tata Motors has carved a niche, leveraging economies of scale and synergies across its diverse product lines. With extensive production facilities in India and abroad, coupled with an expansive distribution network, the company maintains a resilient presence in the automotive industry, constantly navigating challenges and opportunities in an ever-competitive landscape. Mr. Maloy Kumar Gupta Compliance Officer & Company Secretary Mr. Girish Arun Wagh President of Commercial Vehicles Business Unit & Executive Director Mr. Petkar M. Rajendra CTO & President Mr. Rajesh Kannan President and Chief Digital & Information Officer Ms. Namrata Divekar Head of Treasury and Investor Relations Mr. Sudeep Bhalla Head of Corporate Communications Mr. Shubhranshu Singh Vice President of Marketing of Domestic & International business Mr. Sitaram Kandi Chief Human Resource Officer Mr. R. Remind Me Later | No, Thank You AD Print Text -Size Twitter LinkedIn WhatsApp HomeResearch ItTATA MOTORS PASSENGER VEHICLES LIMITEDTATA MOTORS 2024-25 Annual Report Analysis TATA MOTORS 2024-25 Annual Report Analysis Tue, 27 May TATA MOTORS has announced its results for the year ended March 2025. Let us have a look at the detailed performance review of the company during FY24-25. TATA MOTORS Income Statement Analysis Operating income during the year rose 1.3% on a year-on-year (YoY) basis. The company's operating profit decreased by 5.0% YoY during the fiscal. Operating profit margins witnessed a fall and stood at 12.4% in FY25 as against 13.3% in FY24. Depreciation charges decreased by 14.6% and finance costs decreased by 33.1% YoY, respectively. Other income grew by 30.2% YoY. Net profit for the year declined by 28.3% YoY. Net profit margins during the year declined from 7.5% in FY24 to 5.3% in FY25. TATA MOTORS Income Statement 2024-25 No. of Mths Year Ending 12 Mar-24* 12 Mar-25* % Change Net Sales Rs m 4,340,160 4,396,950 1.3% Other income Rs m 56,920 74,120 30.2% Total Revenues Rs m 4,397,080 4,471,070 1.7% Gross profit Rs m 575,700 547,070 -5.0% Depreciation Rs m 272,390 232,560 -14.6% Interest Rs m 75,940 50,830 -33.1% Profit before tax Rs m 284,290 337,800 18.8% Tax Rs m -40,240 105,020 NA Profit after tax Rs m 324,530 232,780 -28.3% Gross profit margin % 13.3 12.4 Effective tax rate % -14.2 31.1 Net profit margin % 7.5 5.3 * Results ConsolidatedInterim results exclude extraordinary / exceptional items Source: Accord Fintech, Equitymaster For Investors: A Potential Mega Wealth Creation Opportunity TATA MOTORS Balance Sheet Analysis The company's current liabilities during FY25 down at Rs 1,667 billion as compared to Rs 1,736 billion in FY24, thereby witnessing an decrease of -4.0%. Long-term debt down at Rs 402 billion as compared to Rs 621 billion during FY24, a fall of 35.3%. Current assets fell 5% and stood at Rs 1,598 billion, while fixed assets rose 12% and stood at Rs 2,111 billion in FY25. Overall, the total assets and liabilities for FY25 stood at Rs 3,715 billion as against Rs 3,576 billion during FY24, thereby witnessing a growth of 4%. TATA MOTORS Balance Sheet as on March 2025 No. of Mths Year Ending 12 Mar-24* 12 Mar-25* % Change Networth Rs m 848,270 1,160,500 36.8 Current Liabilities Rs m 1,736,160 1,666,840 -4.0 Long-term Debt Rs m 621,490 402,170 -35.3 Total Liabilities Rs m 3,575,650 3,714,660 3.9 Current assets Rs m 1,677,180 1,598,110 -4.7 Fixed Assets Rs m 1,891,730 2,111,410 11.6 Total Assets Rs m 3,575,650 3,714,660 3.9 * Results ConsolidatedInterim results exclude extraordinary / exceptional items Source: Accord Fintech, Equitymaster TATA MOTORS Cash Flow Statement Analysis TATA MOTORS's cash flow from operating activities (CFO) during FY25 stood at Rs 631 billion on a YoY basis. Cash flow from investing activities (CFI) during FY25 stood at Rs -476 billion, an improvement of 108.5% on a YoY basis. Cash flow from financial activities (CFF) during FY25 stood at Rs -188 billion, an improvement of 49% on a YoY basis. Overall, net cash flows for the company during FY25 stood at Rs -57 billion from the Rs 81 billion net cash flows seen during FY24. TATA MOTORS Cash Flow Statement 2024-25 Particulars No. of months 12 12 % Change Year Ending Mar-24 Mar-25 Cash Flow from Operating Activities Rs m 679,150 631,020 -7.1% Cash Flow from Investing Activities Rs m -228,280 -475,940 - Cash Flow from Financing Activities Rs m -370,060 -187,860 - Net Cash Flow Rs m 81,280 -56,660 - * Results ConsolidatedInterim results exclude extraordinary / exceptional items Source: Accord Fintech, Equitymaster Current Valuations for TATA MOTORS The trailing twelve-month earnings per share (EPS) of the company stands at Rs 63.2, an decline from the EPS of Rs 84.7 recorded last year. The price to earnings (P/E) ratio, at the current price of Rs 724.1, stands at 11.6 times its trailing twelve months earnings. The price to book value (P/BV) ratio at current price levels stands at 2.3 times, while the price to sales ratio stands at 0.6 times. The company's price to cash flow (P/CF) ratio stood at 7.1 times its end-of-year operating cash flow earnings. Rs 1,132.5 1,194.4 TTM Earnings per share Rs 84.7 63.2 Diluted earnings per share Rs 88.2 63.2 Price to Cash Flow x 6.1 7.1 TTM P/E ratio x 11.7 11.6 Price / Book Value ratio x 3.4 2.8 Market Cap Rs m 2,845,535 3,286,064 Dividends per share (Unadj.) Rs 6.0 6.0 * Results ConsolidatedInterim results exclude extraordinary / exceptional items Source: Accord Fintech, Equitymaster Ratio Analysis for TATA MOTORS Solvency Ratios Current Ratio: The company's current ratio deteriorated and stood at 1.0x during FY25, from 1.0x during FY24. The current ratio measures the company's ability to pay short-term and long-term obligations. Interest Coverage Ratio: The company's interest coverage ratio improved and stood at 7.6x during FY25, from 4.7x during FY24. The interest coverage ratio of a company states how easily a company can pay its interest expense on outstanding debt. A higher ratio is preferable. Profitability Ratios Return on Equity (ROE): The ROE for the company declined and down at 20.1% during FY25, from 38.3% during FY25. The ROE measures the ability of a firm to generate profits from its shareholders capital in the company. Return on Capital Employed (ROCE): The ROCE for the company improved and stood at 24.9% during FY25, from 24.5% during FY24. The ROCE measures the ability of a firm to generate profits from its total capital (shareholder capital plus debt capital) employed in the company. Return on Assets (ROA): The ROA of the company declined and down at 7.6% during FY25, from 11.2% during FY24. The ROA measures how efficiently the company uses its assets to generate earnings. Key Ratio Analysis No. of Mths Year Ending 12 Mar-24* 12 Mar-25* Current ratio x 1.0 1.0 Debtors’ Days Days 1 1 Interest coverage x 4.7 7.6 Debt to equity ratio x 0.7 0.3 Return on assets % 11.2 7.6 Return on equity % 38.3 20.1 Return on capital employed % 24.5 24.9 * Results ConsolidatedInterim results exclude extraordinary / exceptional items Source: Accord Fintech, Equitymaster To see how TATA MOTORS has performed over the last 5 years, please visit here. TATA MOTORS Share Price Performance Over the last one year, TATA MOTORS share price has moved down from Rs 958.0 to Rs 724.1, registering a loss of Rs 233.9 or around 24.4%. Meanwhile, the S&P BSE AUTO Index is trading at Rs 53,096.4 (down 0.4%). Over the last one year it has moved down from 54,219.6 to 53,096.4, a loss of 1,123 points (down 2.1%). Overall, the S&P BSE SENSEX is up 8.9% over the year. (To know more, check out historical annual results for TATA MOTORS and quarterly results for TATA MOTORS) Annual Report FAQs What is the curren
